metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Mayrina after she is cured from the hag curse. In the dialogue she gives hag research book that makes hag fight easier (there is the scroll of Burning Pearls inside), provides her husband reactivity based on how players handled him in Act 1 and may give players the quest reward for killing the hag
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - Auntie Ethel's Revenge → Hag was defeated in Act I- If S_HAG_Hagspawn_SurrogateMother_08c970d7-3138-45e8-8965-68eadf4b07cd is not there, then debugbook Act3 → LOW - Auntie Ethel's Revenge → Mayrina survived in Act I- Debug kill  |Voodoo doll| - S_LOW_HagSurvivors_VoodooDoll 5b0a0081-d158-4c19-8796-5628cc03672a - (-49; 15; -146) - Click on Mayrina - S_HAG_Hagspawn_SurrogateMother - 08c970d7-3138-45e8-8965-68eadf4b07cd - (-68 4 258)

49.speaker: Mayrina
49.text: That lying, thieving, scaly little shit. I can't believe I let a hag hurt my own people. Again.

103.speaker: Mayrina
103.text: All this blood - and for what? It's just fun and games to her. Damn it all.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Mayrina? What are you doing here?

182.speaker: Mayrina
182.text: I'm hunting a hag - what else?

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Care to explain what the hells is going on here?

95.speaker: Mayrina
95.text: Sorry, I'll start at the beginning.

90.speaker: Mayrina
90.text: After you saved me from Ethel, I was ashamed - of how stupid I was. How helpless.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I'm sorry for hurting your friends.
135.context: NodeContext: grim, tired, heartboken but doesn't blame player

82.speaker: Mayrina
82.text: It's not your fault - it's Ethel's. She's after me - and for good reason.
82.context: NodeContext: grim, tired, heartboken but doesn't blame player

191.speaker: Mayrina
191.text: It's not your fault - it's mine. There's a hag hunting me - and for good reason.
191.context: NodeContext: grim, tired, angry at herself

137.speaker: Mayrina
137.text: Unfortunately. I stuck my nose in a hag's business, and she hexed me in return.

101.speaker: Mayrina
101.text: Unfortunately. I stuck my nose in Ethel's business, and she hexed me in return.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: This is the last time I save you, understand?

51.speaker: Mayrina
51.text: Any luck? Have you found the hag?

190.speaker: Player
190.context: NodeContext: sad, is beginning to think she'll  never get connor back but won't admit it

20.speaker: Mayrina
20.text: At the beginning, I saw a spark of the old Connor in his eyes. But recently - nothing.
20.context: NodeContext: sad, is beginning to think she'll  never get connor back but won't admit it

130.speaker: Mayrina
130.text: But I won't give up - I can't.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Why are you still dragging that corpse around with you?

32.speaker: Mayrina
32.text: He's not a corpse, he's my husband - the man I vowed to support through sickness and health. And I intend to keep that promise.

179.speaker: Mayrina
179.text: You don't like it? Fine. But keep your comments to yourself.

117.speaker: Mayrina
117.text: You need to find her - and soon. Who knows how many people she's hurting?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I found the hag - it's Auntie Ethel. She's back.

129.speaker: Mayrina
129.text: Gods, I should've known. Who else would've turned me into a sheep? To think she's been a stone's throw from Connor and me this whole time...

102.speaker: Mayrina
102.text: Wait - Ethel's magic turned him into this monster. If she's still alive, maybe that's why he's stuck like this!

17.speaker: Mayrina
17.text: If you kill Ethel, maybe - maybe he can be human again?

155.speaker: Mayrina
155.text: It's a long shot but it's all I've got. Just focus on killing Ethel. The sooner she's dead, the bloody better.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'll kill Ethel - that's all I can guarantee.

12.speaker: Mayrina
12.text: That's all I ask - thank you.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Just let Connor die - it's the merciful thing.
4.context: NodeContext: player has suggested killing connor (zombie husband) might be the only way, she brushes it off with a wave and suggests killing ethel first - she doesn't even want to consider killing connor

18.speaker: Mayrina
18.text: Just try - all right? That's all I ask. And if - if it doesn't work, I'll figure something else out.
18.context: NodeContext: player has suggested killing connor (zombie husband) might be the only way, she brushes it off with a wave and suggests killing ethel first - she doesn't even want to consider killing connor

194.speaker: Mayrina
194.text: What?  You mean we've been a stone's throw from each other this whole time?
194.context: NodeContext: just found out ethel, her old hag enemy, is in the city

107.speaker: Mayrina
107.text: My heart is pounding at the thought.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: I don't blame you - she's terrifying.

39.speaker: Mayrina
39.text: Oh, I'm not scared - I'm excited. You can make her pay for everything she's done - everyone she's hurt.

199.speaker: Mayrina
199.text: I've given you the tools you need to take her down - but I need a favour. When she dies screaming?

166.speaker: Mayrina
166.context: NodeContext: vicious - this is her payback, this is her moment to get back at ethel

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Pull yourself together - I'll be doing all the work.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: I'll keep you safe, don't worry.

74.speaker: Mayrina
74.text: We're finally free from Ethel - thanks to you. I can't wait to start living again.
74.context: NodeContext: smile - grateful for life. Excited

76.speaker: Mayrina
76.text: So, you feeling up to killing a hag yet?

140.speaker: Mayrina
140.text: I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in twoNodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in twoNodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

13.text: What have you done?! You BASTARD!
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in twoNodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

99.speaker: Mayrina
99.text: What have you done?! You BASTARD!
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in twoNodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Killing Ethel would be a pleasure.

79.speaker: Mayrina
79.text: She's dead, isn't she? Ethel is dead?
79.context: NodeContext: awe and wonder in her voice

180.speaker: Player
180.text: She is - but the child didn't survive.

44.speaker: Mayrina
44.text: I thought we'd finally get a happy ending. But when hags are involved, there's no such thing.

6.speaker: Mayrina
6.text: At least Ethel can't hurt anyone else. Not anymore - thanks to you. I bet killing her felt amazing.

19.speaker: Player
19.context: NodeContext: ethel is dead - absolutely ELATED

80.speaker: Mayrina
80.context: NodeContext: ethel is dead - absolutely ELATED

164.speaker: Mayrina
164.text: Fuck you, Ethel, you miserable old bat. Fuck you for telling me I'd be an awful mum. That I was nothing but a 'pregnant half-wit'!
164.context: NodeContext: ethel is dead - absolutely ELATED. Shouting at the air

172.speaker: Mayrina
172.text: Oh, and the girl! You saved her too, right?
172.context: NodeContext: with a jerk, remembers vanra. Excited, convinced player has saved vanra (might have, might not have)

7.speaker: Mayrina
7.text: I felt it, I think. It was like a piece of glass had been lodged in my chest - and was finally pulled free.

175.speaker: Mayrina
175.text: And the girl? You saved her, right?

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I tried my best - but she didn't make it.

157.speaker: Mayrina
157.text: You hear that, Connor? Ethel is dead! Oh.
157.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to connorNodeContext: turns to connor, big smile on her face - drops at 'Oh'

104.speaker: Mayrina
104.text: You didn't change back. You're still a... a zombie.

197.speaker: Mayrina
197.text: I thought with Ethel gone - never mind. I'll - I'll find another way to turn you back. Somehow.
197.context: NodeContext: upset but trying to hide it

122.speaker: Player
122.text: He's never going to be human again. You have to let him go.
122.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't want to face a life without connor

45.speaker: Mayrina
45.text: I know. Damn it, I know.
45.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't want to face a life without connor

113.speaker: Mayrina
113.text: I know. Damn it, I know.
113.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't want to face a life without connor

5.speaker: Mayrina
5.text: Connor - I love you. I've loved you since we were kids, and you picked me bluebells and asked me to the summer fair.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: looking at connorNodeContext: crying, remembering how much she loves connor, how long she's loved him

38.speaker: Mayrina
38.text: But you're gone. And this... thing isn't you. Not anymore.
38.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

46.speaker: Player
46.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

64.speaker: Mayrina
64.text: Then why does it feel so terrible?
64.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I can't believe you just killed him.
22.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

9.speaker: Mayrina
9.text: No, Ethel did. I just let him go.
9.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

15.speaker: Mayrina
15.text: Here. Thank you for killing Ethel, but I'd like you to go now. I'll be fine - I know I'm stronger than this. I just need some time.
15.context: NodeContext: drying her eyes, pulling herself together as best she can.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I'm sorry you couldn't save him.
152.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

183.speaker: Mayrina
183.text: Not everyone can be saved - I learned that lesson from Ethel. I just needed you to remind me.
183.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

174.speaker: Mayrina
174.text: No - no, I made a vow the day I married him. And I'm not going back on it just because things are hard.
174.context: NodeContext: briefly considered killing her zombie husband, then shakes off the thought, determined, grim

8.text: No - no, I made a vow the day I married him. And I'm not going back on it just because things are hard.
8.context: NodeContext: briefly considered killing her zombie husband, then shakes off the thought, determined, grim

187.speaker: Mayrina
187.text: No - no, I made a vow the day I married him. And I'm not going back on it just because things are hard.
187.context: NodeContext: briefly considered killing her zombie husband, then shakes off the thought, determined, grim

121.speaker: Mayrina
121.text: But here - you should be out celebrating. You killed a hag, after all. Don't worry about us, we'll be fine - all three of us.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands on tummyNodeContext: sad smile

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You helped me take down Ethel - give yourself time to celebrate.

35.speaker: Mayrina
35.text: Only a little. But it'll be nice to finally sleep with both eyes shut. Thank you.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I killed Ethel for you. I expect a reward. Now.

109.speaker: Mayrina
109.text: Of course - here. Because of you, I'll finally be able to sleep with both eyes shut. Thank you.

127.speaker: Mayrina
127.text: Ah - they say revenge doesn't fix anything, but damn does it feel amazing. Thank you.
127.context: NodeContext: shakes head, delighted and a little fierce

123.speaker: Mayrina
123.text: Ah - I wish I could have done it myself. But you are the next best thing.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I prefer my thank-yous to be of the coin variety.
138.context: NodeContext: wants to make the player feel better, to understand that what they did was amazing

28.speaker: Player
28.text: It didn't feel so amazing when she was vomiting up a child.
28.context: NodeContext: wants to make the player feel better, to understand that what they did was amazing

78.speaker: Mayrina
78.text: A living child. That's what matters.
78.context: NodeContext: wants to make the player feel better, to understand that what they did was amazing

207.speaker: Mayrina
207.text: Here - call this a small thank you. I look forward to finally being able to sleep with both eyes shut.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I don't feel amazing - a child died.

112.speaker: Mayrina
112.text: Guilt won't bring her back. You did more than anyone else - and think how many children can sleep safer now.

167.speaker: Mayrina
167.text: This won't fix anything - but take it. You've earned it. And you'll always be a hero to me.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Sure did - all in a day's work.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I fought and killed her in her lair - it was a perversion of everything natural.

87.speaker: Mayrina
87.text: Did you find the missing girl's mother? Lora?

204.speaker: Mayrina
204.text: Keep searching - a hag is behind this, I know it.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I did - her daughter Vanra is missing.

178.speaker: Mayrina
178.text: Vanra? That's a beautiful name. I hope I can tell her that someday.

14.speaker: Mayrina
14.text: If you find Vanra, you'll find the hag - I'm sure of it. Keep searching - we can't let that monster run loose.

120.speaker: Mayrina
120.text: Urgh, my mouth tastes like mutton. We're not safe - there's a traitor...
120.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

16.speaker: Mayrina
16.text: The dragonborn... He's working for Ethel.
16.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

71.speaker: Mayrina
71.text: The dragonborn... He's working for the hag.
71.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

145.speaker: Mayrina
145.text: Don't get your hopes up, but I'm half-considering naming my child after you - you've certainly earned it.

147.speaker: Mayrina
147.text: So, you feeling up to killing Ethel yet?

149.speaker: Mayrina
149.text: That lying, thieving, shitty little redcap. I can't believe I fell for a hag's tricks. Again.

192.speaker: Mayrina
192.text: That lying, thieving, scaly little shit. Thanks for knifing the bastard.

188.speaker: Mayrina
188.text: That makes twice you've saved me. I'm starting to think you're my guardian angel.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Good to see you again, Mayrina.
139.context: NodeContext: affection in opening line at seeing player, determined for rest

1.speaker: Mayrina
1.text: You too. I've come a long way since we last met. Decided I was sick and tired of feeling stupid. Helpless.
1.context: NodeContext: affection in opening line at seeing player, determined for rest

158.speaker: Mayrina
158.text: So I decided I wasn't going to be a victim anymore.

165.speaker: Mayrina
165.text: This group is made of survivors - people like me who've been hurt by hags. I brought them together to fight back.

40.speaker: Mayrina
40.text: We tracked a hag to the city, but lost her trail - right after she snatched a little girl.
40.context: NodeContext: disgusted with herself, feels she should have done more

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Any leads on the missing girl?

92.speaker: Mayrina
92.text: None. Her mother has no idea of what she's up against. Poor woman thinks the Fist will be able to help her.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Any connection to our old friend Ethel?

210.speaker: Mayrina
210.text: I bloody hope not - I see her enough in my dreams. No, Ethel is dead - thanks to you.

55.speaker: Mayrina
55.text: But this one is no less of a nightmare.

83.speaker: Mayrina
83.text: The moment I started investigating the missing girl, I felt the hag's eye on me. Next thing, I was sprouting wool and bleating up a storm.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Wait - is this Lora? She said her daughter disappeared in the Blushing Mermaid.
118.context: NodeContext: excited, this is a lead

54.speaker: Mayrina
54.text: That's her! And she vanished in the 'Maid? That sounds like a lead.
54.context: NodeContext: excited, this is a lead

21.speaker: Mayrina
21.text: We'll do what we can to find the girl, but our chances are a lot higher with you on our side.

128.speaker: Mayrina
128.text: Check the safe in the back. I've done my homework on hags since we last tangled with Ethel - take whatever you need. I know it by heart anyway.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I met the child's mother - not sure I trust her. Or her story.
85.context: NodeContext: sarcastic smile at the beginning (she knows she was a nightmare).

62.speaker: Mayrina
62.text: Have you forgotten how 'charming' I was when Ethel took me? Hags lie and cheat - they'll do anything to mess with our heads.
62.context: NodeContext: sarcastic smile at the beginning (she knows she was a nightmare).

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I'm already looking for the child.
189.context: NodeContext: with a smile, player has impressed her

91.speaker: Mayrina
91.context: NodeContext: with a smile, player has impressed her

61.speaker: Player
61.text: A child's life is on the line - allow me to help.
61.context: NodeContext: looking away in beginning, ashamed of how she fell for the hag's lies. Determined at the end - she won't let lora suffer the same fate

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I'm here to help - I'll start by speaking to the child's mother.
23.context: NodeContext: looking away in beginning, ashamed of how she fell for the hag's lies. Determined at the end - she won't let lora suffer the same fate

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You were going to give your kid to a hag willingly - maybe this is the same.
24.context: NodeContext: looking away in beginning, ashamed of how she fell for the hag's lies. Determined at the end - she won't let lora suffer the same fate

111.speaker: Mayrina
111.text: When someone tells you, day in day out, that you'd be a useless mother... well, you start to believe it. Who knows what she's done to this woman?
111.context: NodeContext: looking away in beginning, ashamed of how she fell for the hag's lies. Determined at the end - she won't let lora suffer the same fate

36.speaker: Mayrina
36.text: Look, I know you're busy with big-time heroics, but we need your help. A child's life is on the line - and her mother is the best lead we've got.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Of course - a child is in danger. I will do what I can.

142.speaker: Mayrina
142.text: Thank you. With you at our side, that hag won't know what hit her.

148.speaker: Mayrina
148.text: Lora was knocking about Basilisk Gate - at the Flaming Fist's headquarters. Good luck.

184.speaker: Player
184.context: NodeContext: little hurt, but also determined to help the mother regardless

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You'll have to deal with this yourself.
11.context: NodeContext: little hurt, but also determined to help the mother regardless

60.speaker: Mayrina
60.text: Too busy to help regular folk? I get it. But should you ever find yourself in Basilisk Gate, speak to the mother. She deserves that much.
60.context: NodeContext: little hurt, but also determined to help the mother regardless

196.speaker: Mayrina
196.context: NodeContext: a little smile, knows player is going to be impressed

48.speaker: Player
48.text: And you can't do this without me because...?

66.speaker: Mayrina
66.text: I tried - and look where it got me. Chewing hay and shitting pellets.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Let me guess - you want me to help.

126.speaker: Mayrina
126.text: You've seen what Ethel did - imagine the destruction a hag could cause in a city this size? With people this desperate?

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Does this hag have a lair?

150.speaker: Mayrina
150.text: What hag doesn't? Best guess says it's close to where the mother lives - but I've no hard evidence.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: You're on your own this time.
193.context: NodeContext: determined in first line, deflated that player isn't gonna help in the rest

198.speaker: Mayrina
198.text: No - I'm not. I've got my team. But I understand you're busy with big-time heroics these days. Thanks anyway.
198.context: NodeContext: determined in first line, deflated that player isn't gonna help in the rest

201.speaker: Mayrina
201.text: Fine - you're busy with big-time heroics these days. Thanks anyway.

100.speaker: Mayrina
100.text: And it worked - the shitty redcap proves it. Ethel is here.
100.context: NodeContext: grim, determined - wants to get ethel

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: happily smug (not in a shitty way), because she knows something the player doesn't

132.speaker: Mayrina
132.text: Ah, now that I can help you with.
132.context: NodeContext: happily smug (not in a shitty way), because she knows something the player doesn't

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I dealt with her once, and I'll do it again.

52.speaker: Mayrina
52.text: I told everyone who'd listen about you - how you marched into Ethel's lair as if it were a tea party.

185.speaker: Mayrina
185.text: You're as tough as I remember. And this time, when you put Ethel down, she'll stay down.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I don't like having enemies who won't stay dead.

84.speaker: Mayrina
84.text: Then you're in luck - because I know how to kill her.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I know - her existence warps the balance of everything natural.

98.speaker: Mayrina
98.text: Oh, don't worry. I know how to kill her - and make sure she stays that way.

144.speaker: Mayrina
144.text: Check the safe in the back. I've done my homework on hags since we last tangled with Ethel - take whatever you need. I know it by heart anyway.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: If Ethel is after you, that's your problem. You're on your own.

26.speaker: Mayrina
26.text: Thanks, but my mouth tastes like mutton, and I'm itching in hard-to-reach places.

43.speaker: Mayrina
43.text: I'm going to make the witch that did this pay. And I have the means to do it.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: This is the last time - I'm tired of having to save people over and over again.
114.context: NodeContext: proud, a little cheeky at the end

170.speaker: Mayrina
170.text: I'm not the helpless brat you met in Ethel's lair. You're looking at one of the Realms' finest hag hunters.
170.context: NodeContext: proud, a little cheeky at the end

200.speaker: Mayrina
200.text: Stay close to me, Connor - all right?

163.speaker: Mayrina
163.text: Did you find the missing girl's mother? Lora?

203.speaker: Mayrina
203.context: NodeContext: distracted, looking over her shoulder

68.speaker: Mayrina
68.text: Sorry - did it work? Is the hag dead?
68.context: NodeContext: blink, like she's just seen the player, concerned

131.speaker: Mayrina
131.text: Sorry - did it work? Is Ethel finally dead?
131.context: NodeContext: blink, like she's just seen the player,
